docs.title: Pedalogical Developer Environment Setup Guide
docs.text:
Welcome! This guide will walk you through setting up your local development environment for contributing to Pedalogical, an AI-enhanced testing and tutoring platform.

Repository: https://github.com/wu-software-lab/AiTutor

By the end of this guide, you will:

  • Have cloned the repository
  • Set up PostgreSQL and pgAdmin in Docker
  • Installed .NET and other necessary tools
  • Initialized and seeded the database
  • Verified that you can run Pedalogical locally and log in

docs.title: Setup Steps
docs.text:
1. Pre-requisites Tools you need installed before starting, including Git, Docker, and .NET.

  2. Clone the Repository How to fork and clone the Pedalogical GitHub repo.

  3. Set Up PostgreSQL + pgAdmin in Docker Instructions for creating a local Postgres container and admin GUI.

  4. Configure the App Setup of appsettings.Development.json for local development.

  5. Run Migrations & Seed the Database Instructions for applying migrations and seeding the database.

  6. Run the Application Build, run, and test the Pedalogical app locally.

docs.title: Final Check
docs.text:
Once you complete all steps, you should be able to:

  • Navigate to https://localhost:5001 (or specified port)
  • Log in using seeded credentials
  • Confirm the application runs as expected

Having trouble? Reach out to the team through Discord.

docs.title: 1. Locate the Repository on GitHub (ensure you are logged in and have access to the repo)
docs.text: Go to https://github.com/wu-software-lab/AiTutor.

docs.title: 2. Clone the Repo
docs.text:
The instructions here and the rest of the guide assume your repo is being cloned into a Repositories directory in your home folder. Adjust paths as needed.

Open a terminal and run:

# Change to your desired directory.
# Recommend having a Projects directory or similar.
# /Users/your-username/Projects.
cd ~/Repositories
git clone https://github.com/wu-software-lab/AiTutor.git
cd AiTutor

You're now ready to set up the database in Step 3: Set Up PostgreSQL + pgAdmin.

docs.title: 1. Locate or Create the Development Config
docs.text:
In the root project folder, ensure you have a file named:

appsettings.Development.json

If it doesn’t exist, create one based on the existing appsettings.json or copy this template:

{
  "ConnectionStrings": {
    "DefaultConnection": "Host=pedalogical-db;Port=5432;Database=pedalogical;Username=pedalogical;Password=devpass"
  },
  "Logging": {
    "LogLevel": {
      "Default": "Information",
      "Microsoft": "Warning",
      "Microsoft.Hosting.Lifetime": "Information"
    }
  }
}

This tells the app how to connect to your Dockerized Postgres instance.

Move on to Step 5: Run Migrations & Seed the Database.

docs.title: Step 3: Set Up PostgreSQL + pgAdmin in Docker
docs.text:
This step sets up a PostgreSQL database and pgAdmin using Docker, specifically configured for Pedalogical development.

📁 All Docker-related config and volume paths will now reference the docker/ directory inside the project repository.

docs.title: Create a Docker Network
docs.text:
docker network create pedalogical-network

This creates a private network that allows Docker containers (PostgreSQL, pgAdmin, and others) to communicate with each other by name.

docs.title: Run PostgreSQL Container
docs.text: Navigate to the root of your Pedalogical repository, then run:

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
docker run -d \
  --name pedalogical-db \
  --network pedalogical-network \
  -e POSTGRES_USER=pedalogical \
  -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=devpass \
  -e POSTGRES_DB=pedalogical \
  -v $(pwd)/Docker/dbdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data \
  -p 5433:5432 \
  postgres:17

docs.title: Windows (PowerShell)
docs.text:
docker run -d `
  --name pedalogical-db `
  --network pedalogical-network `
  -e POSTGRES_USER=pedalogical `
  -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=devpass `
  -e POSTGRES_DB=pedalogical `
  -v ${PWD}\Docker\dbdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data `
  -p 5433:5432 `
  postgres:17

This runs the official Postgres container with:

  • A persistent volume at ./docker/dbdata
  • Custom credentials and a default database
  • Port 5433 exposed to avoid conflicts with local Postgres

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
docker run -d \
  --name pedalogical-pgadmin \
  --network pedalogical-network \
  -e PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL=admin@pedalogical.local \
  -e PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD=admin \
  -v $(pwd)/Docker/pgadmin:/var/lib/pgadmin \
  -p 5050:80 \
  dpage/pgadmin4

docs.title: Windows (PowerShell)
docs.text:
docker run -d `
  --name pedalogical-pgadmin `
  --network pedalogical-network `
  -e PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL=admin@pedalogical.local `
  -e PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD=admin `
  -v ${PWD}\Docker\pgadmin:/var/lib/pgadmin `
  -p 5050:80 `
  dpage/pgadmin4

This will launch the pgAdmin web UI for managing the Postgres instance.

docs.title: Access pgAdmin
docs.text:
Open http://localhost:5050 and log in with:

  • Email: admin@pedalogical.local
  • Password: admin

Then, add a new server in pgAdmin:

  • Name: Pedalogical DB
  • Host: pedalogical-db
  • Port: 5432
  • Username: pedalogical
  • Password: devpass

docs.title: Next Step
docs.text: Continue to Step 4: Configure the App to set up your connection string and local app settings.

docs.title: Step 1: Pre-requisites
docs.text: Before setting up the Pedalogical environment, make sure you have the following tools installed on your system.

docs.title: 1. Git
docs.text:
Used for cloning and managing the project repository.

  • macOS: Git is included with Xcode Command Line Tools

bash xcode-select --install

  • Windows: Download from https://git-scm.com

docs.title: 2. Docker Desktop
docs.text:
Used to run PostgreSQL and pgAdmin containers.

  • macOS:

bash brew install --cask docker-desktop

  • Windows: Download and install from https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop

docs.title: 3. .NET SDK (Version 9+)
docs.text:
Required to build and run the Pedalogical .NET application.

Windows:

  • Download and install from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download

macOS:

brew install --cask dotnet-sdk

Verify installation:

dotnet --version

Once all tools are installed, proceed to Step 2: Clone the Repository.

docs.title: Step 6: Run the Application
docs.text: Now it’s time to run Pedalogical locally and verify everything works.

docs.title: 1. Build and Run the App
docs.text:
From the root project folder:

dotnet run --project AiTutor

Or use:

dotnet watch run --project AiTutor

This will compile and start the web server.

docs.title: 2. Open in Browser
docs.text:
Visit:

https://localhost:5001

(Or use the port displayed in your terminal)

docs.title: 3. Log In
docs.text:
Use the credentials from the seeded database (e.g., test@example.com / password123).

If you reach the dashboard, the environment is working correctly!

Congratulations! Your Pedalogical development environment is fully set up.

docs.title: Step 5: Run Migrations & Seed the Database
docs.text: Now that Postgres is running and your app is configured, you need to apply the database schema and seed initial data.

docs.title: 1. Open a Terminal
docs.text:
Navigate to the project root:

cd AiTutor

docs.title: 2. Apply Migrations
docs.text:
dotnet ef database update --project AiTutor

This will:

  • Create the database schema in the container
  • Apply any pending migrations
  • Seed the database with initial data (including a test user)

Troubleshooting tip: If you get an error like No project was found, try adding the --startup-project AiTutor flag.

Once the database is seeded, continue to Step 6: Run the Application.
